Description: Sherd, probably from the shoulder of a jar; worn by re-use as a scraper; red-brown ware with occasional white grits and flacks of mica; red burnished exterior with painted black stripe
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: A'ali, Presumably Tomb 10, lower chamber
Bibliographic references: Reade & Burleigh 1978a / The 'Ali cemetery: old excavations, ivory and radiocarbon dating (pl. 34b)
Nayeem M A 1992a / Bahrain (329; fig. 18, centre of middle row)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
